events.name: Moxo Attention Test Training
events.description: This training aims to provide information on methods of working with individuals with Attention Deficit and Hyperactivity Disorder and to introduce professionals to the MOXO test, giving them the knowledge and skills to apply the test.

events.name: Narrative Therapy Training
events.description:
Narrative Therapy Training 5th Module dates have been updatedü•≥

Our Narrative Therapy training with the theme of 'Couples and Families' starts on Tuesday, September 3.

events.name: SPSS Data Analysis
events.description:
Introducing SPSS, creating a data file and data entry, descriptive analyses, reliability, normality, correlation, t-test, ANOVA analysis, regression, and non-parametric analyses with examples

At the end of this training, you will be able to do your own thesis.

Participants must install the SPSS program on their computers before the training.

events.name: Cognitive Behavioral Therapy Program for Avoidant/Restrictive Food Intake Disorder
events.description:
Avoidant/Restrictive Food Intake Disorder (ARFID) is a heterogeneous psychiatric disorder characterized by individuals avoiding certain foods or food categories due to increased sensitivity to sensory characteristics (e.g., taste, texture, appearance, smell) of food and/or restricting intake in quantity. One of the most common reasons for avoidance and restriction in ARFID is increased sensitivity to sensory characteristics of food. Individuals diagnosed with ARFID may also avoid or restrict food due to fear of unwanted outcomes such as choking, vomiting, or gastrointestinal pain. These individuals often experience a trauma related to food and then begin to avoid certain foods to protect themselves from another adverse experience. Individuals with ARFID also often show a lack of interest in food or eating and may maintain a limited diet in terms of quantity. Those with lack of interest describe eating as a chore, and this is often reflected in a low appetite.

Psychological therapies are prominent in the treatment of ARFID. A cognitive-behavioral therapy (CBT-AR) has been developed for ARFID. This therapy includes three optional modules that the therapist can apply depending on the patient‚Äôs primary maintenance mechanism. This therapy can be applied in an individual format or with family support, depending on the patient's age, and can last 20-30 sessions depending on the severity of the eating disorder. This training will address ARFID treatment from a psychotherapeutic perspective.

This program consists of 4 sessions and a total of 8 hours.

events.name: Free Webinar: Safe Haven: Psychotherapy with Children and Adolescents
events.description:
Participation is open to everyone and a digital participation certificate will be shared with live viewers.

We are coming together on the evening of September 12, 2024, at 21.00 to talk about the 'safe haven'.

The safe haven is a concept developed by Dr. Darcia Narvaez that describes the necessary care system for babies, children, and adolescents to reach their potential. The safe haven aims to meet the emotional, social, and physiological needs of children with evolutionary proven care practices and environmental conditions.

How to create a safe haven? How can psychotherapy and psychoeducation be used to provide a safe haven for babies, children, and adolescents? How can psychotherapists, parents, and educators collaborate to support the healthy development of children?

Let‚Äôs come together to grow and create a safe and supportive haven for our babies, children, and adolescents. Looking forward to seeing you on September 12 at 21:00.

events.name: Cognitive Behavioral Therapy Certification Program
events.description: The CBT Certification Program organized by Assoc. Dr. Itƒ±r Tarƒ± C√∂mert consists of 10 modules and 130 hours. The content of the program is shaped parallel to the Beck Institute training program, developed in light of Assoc. Dr. Itƒ±r Tarƒ± C√∂mert‚Äôs 20 years of CBT experiences. Participants will gain practical experience in using these techniques effectively and formulating them with the theoretical knowledge of CBT's basic concepts and techniques. The program is supported by various learning methods, such as applied sessions, example session videos, role plays, supervision-supported repeat sessions, and case analyses. This certification program aims to provide participants with comprehensive knowledge and skills in CBT. Assoc. Dr. Itƒ±r Tarƒ± C√∂mert‚Äôs knowledge and experiences form an important resource to enhance the program's quality and offer participants an effective learning experience.

events.name: Free Webinar: Our New Assistant AI
events.description:
Participation is open to everyone and a digital participation certificate will be shared with live viewers.

We are coming together on the evening of October 3, 2024, at 21.00 to talk about the new era of our profession.

Can artificial intelligence do therapy, can it replace the therapist? How can psychologists benefit from artificial intelligence in psychotherapy, community mental health, schools, etc.?

Let‚Äôs grow and learn together. Looking forward to seeing you on October 3 at 21:00.

events.name: Free Webinar: Body in Couple Therapy
events.description:
Participation is open to everyone and a digital participation certificate will be shared with live viewers.

We are coming together on the evening of October 10, 2024, at 21.00 to talk about body-oriented work in couple therapy with Jennifer Gardner, an instructor from the International Sensorimotor Psychotherapy Institute.

How can we benefit from body-oriented work while working with couples? What are the body-oriented practices and techniques we can use to strengthen the couple's relationship?

Let‚Äôs grow and learn together. Looking forward to seeing you on October 10 at 21:00.
